sentence: hard evidence on the level of liquidity in secondary treasury markets is mixed, with some measures at or above pre-crisis levels and some suggesting a reduced ability to buy or sell large positions without material price effect--a reasonable definition of liquidity.3 it is also possible that liquidity may be more prone to disappearing at times of stress.

sentence: on october 15, for example, market depth declined sharply, and we saw a sudden spike in prices that was without precedent for a period with little relevant news.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: other events--such as the 2013 "taper tantrum," the "bund tantrum" last spring, and the sharp moves on march 18 in the euro-dollar exchange rate--all broadly show the same pattern: rapidly diminishing liquidity, and large price moves for a given quantum of news.4 but the causes and implications of these events are unclear.
label: LABEL_2
